content.raw:
Note to self: Add support for dynamic timebase.

While the PLL seems to default to the internal clock ticking at 100MHz, this can be adjusted. Also, there is no requirement on the external reference frequency \(except that presumably it has an upper limit somewhere…\). So these need to be able to be specified in the constructor in labscript, and stored somewhere \(as it affects measuring the length of waits\). A further consequence of this is all of the timing delays are actually just multiple of the reference \(at least from my reading of the FPGA code\) so they should be defined as such. Not sure how easy it is to dynamically set some of these though, so need to investigate it!
